syntax.param: Index 0 denotes the first element, 1 the second, etc. If index has decimal places it gets rounded down for fractions less than or equal .5, otherwise it gets rounded up.
Index 0 denotes the first element, 1 the second, etc. If index has decimal places it gets rounded down for fractions less than or equal .5, otherwise it gets rounded up.

array.param: String position to start selection from. 0 denotes the first character of the string, 1 the second, etc. If passed number has decimal places it gets rounded down for fractions less than or equal .5, otherwise it gets rounded up.
Number of the string characters to select. If "length" is omitted, selection will be made from "start" to the end of the string.
Array index to start selection from.
Number of array elements to select. If the selected range exceeds source array boundaries, selection will be made up to the last element of the array.

return.value: array of all elements from the original array that satisfied expression condition

syntax.param: expression that is expected to return Boolean or Nothing. If true is returned, the original array value of currently tested element _x will be added to the output array
